subject: Re: [junit] Problem in creating JUnit test case
msgSnippet: I hate to repeat Michael s question, but can you provide a) evidence that your project is indeed recognized by Eclipse as a Java project (for example, it has a
messageBody:
I hate to repeat Michael's question, but can you provide

a) evidence that your project is indeed recognized by Eclipse as a Java
project (for example, it has a J annotation)
b) the _exact_ error message you're seeing

Thanks,

David Saff

On 11/13/06, avinash anand <avinash_anand@...> wrote:
>
> Hi
> Actually I am trying to create a JUnit test case inside a Java project.
> like in package com.xyz.ataria But when I am trying to take wizard's help
> It gives a notification error (On top on eclipse wizard) that the project is
> not a java folder.
>
> -Avinash
>
>
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message ----
> From: Michael Bria <bria526xp@...>
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Saturday, 11 November, 2006 4:04:10 AM
> Subject: Re: [junit] Problem in creating JUnit test case
>
> Avinash,
>
> Is the project you're attempting to add the tests to in fact java project?
> (It's icon decorator would be folder w/ a little J)
>
> On 11/9/06, avinash anand <avinash_anand@ yahoo.co. uk> wrote:
> >
> > Hi All
> > I am trying to create a test suite in JUnit eclipse project to
> > test the exception handelling of 11 API's.
> >
> > The process I am following is
> >
> > 1. Create a test folder inside the project which needs to be tested.
> This
> > folder is going to contain test classes
> > 2. When Inside this folder I am right clicking to obtain the new JUnit
> > test case creation wizard. I am getting an error
> >
> >
> > The error says the "source folder is not a Java project". The above
> steps
> > followed by me are in reference to a doccument present on the internet @
> > http://open. ncsu.edu/ se/tutorials/ junit
> >
> > I have one more doubt, Why do we use the setUP(), tearDown() and
> > constructor( ) while working with the test case creation wizard.
> >
> > Please help me to come up with a solution of this.
> >
> >
> > Thanks in Advance
> >
> > Avinash
> >
